metadata.title: CVE-2017-7525 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A deserialization flaw was discovered in the jackson-databind, versionsbefore 2.6.7.1, 2.7.9.1 and 2.8.9, which could allow an unauthenticateduser to perform code execution by sending the maliciously crafted input tothe readValue method of the ObjectMapper.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.2.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libjackson-json-java - 1.9.2-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
libjackson-json-java package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.2-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1').
